translation.en: ♪ And I just wanna be here with you ♪
♪ But this year is bringing me the blues ♪
♪ Now I stand here alone Under our mistletoe ♪
♪ And I need my baby home ♪
♪ I don't need no stocking Or material things ♪
♪ No, I just want my baby home ♪
♪ I've just one wish On my Christmas list ♪
♪ Please send my baby back home ♪
Feel free to take a seat in front of the backdrop.
I will be with you in a moment.
We're also running a deal where you can get your pictures printed
on a mug and a T- shirt.
How's this for a passport photo?
- Why didn't you text me？ - Just got back just now.
You really nailed this whole backpacking- American,
crashing- in- a- New- Zealand- hostel look.
My hostel was in Amsterdam. New Zealand was last month.
You're supposed to follow every single word of my travel blog.
- What happened? - It's 18 months of words, okay?
I'm looking at the photos, though.
Still working in this place, I see.
- Does it feed your soul? - Nope.
Don't let me interrupt you not doing your job, Abby.
I need you to take this to Santa's Village,
You didn't forget that Santa's Village starts tomorrow, did you?
How could I forget? It's my favorite time of year.
Are you here to buy something?
This is my oldest friend, Josh.
He's the one that got me into photography.
Remember that film camera, long ago that we were learning on?
I think it's in a box.
Oh, no. I'm just here to see Abby.
Then I have a box for you to take down to my car.
I wanted to look like you.
And she nailed it. Just for the family Christmas photo.
- Mom is freaking out. - I bet.
I put a little something special in there. I thought you'd need it.
You know me so well, big sis.
What do you think of the tree?
The theme this year is ornament splendor.
You can help me finish decorating the mantle.
I start holiday hours tomorrow, so I should be good, but thanks, Dad.
He still asks me the same thing, and I work with him.
I'm just saying you're welcome to join us at the law firm.
Sarah and I have a great time working together,
- isn't that right, Sarah- bear? - Yes, we do.
You do know that photography is a great hobby.
It's just not the safest career choice.
You realize you tell me the same thing every time I come home, right?
Mm- hm, and that's because we're hoping that one day you'll actually hear us.
Nope? Just me? Okay. I'm gonna top it off.
You are going to change your clothes for the photograph?
Gramps, I was wondering where you were hiding.
Hey, sweetheart. Come and give your grampops a hug.
Ah, I see you're making your famous chili.
I made a vegetarian one for you and me. Shh!
- How's it going with your new roommates? - Ah, they are so boring.
They go to bed by nine o'clock.
Then they complain my music's too loud.
I'm losing my hair and I'm getting old. How else am I supposed to play it?
- Oh, who's that? - I'll get it.
The Sutton decorating parties are like Christmas cards coming to life,
not the little flimsy dollar- store ones.
- What's going on, son? - Gramps! Look at you!
- Good to see you, man! Welcome back! - Good to see you, too.
- Looking good! - You, too. Back in town, huh?
Everybody's gonna be so excited you're here, it'll get them off my back.
- When did you get back? - Mmm.
- All right, son. - Good to see you.
- Has he gotten cuter since he’s been away? - I know what y’all are tryin’ to do.
- It’s not gonna work. We’re just friends. - Okay.
So Josh, where are you off to next?
What? You didn't tell me that!
Well, I'm staying with Fernando up until I find my own place,
but one thing I do know is that
it's time for our Sutton holiday photo!
- Can I get an ornaments on three? - Yes.
Beautiful. Now can I get some smiles?
Smiles is what I need. I love a smile.
I think we should go with the silly one. You have to.
All right, you bunch of hams.
I didn't want to give you this in front of everyone.
I found it when I was packing my old house.
She wanted you to have it.
First Christmas without her is tough.
- How you doing? - She's with me everyday.
I must admit it was hard to move, but,
she wouldn't want me to live in that big house by myself.
- Check it out. - What is it?
The kind the Europeans used to make before those flimsy, cardboard- paper kind.
Are you sure she wanted me to have it and not Sarah?
- Seems more her style. - Sure I’m sure.
Son, after all the years I’ve known you, I’ve never seen you
How am I gonna say no to Miss Judy’s baking?
So, you going to stick around for a while, right?
- I'm here. - Josh, I love it when you’re here.
Your appetite distracts Mom from hounding me about my life choices.
Y'know, she actually asked me what I thought about your life choices.
So, technically... you ain’t off the hook yet.
- I love you, Gramps. - I love you more, sweetheart.
I'll see you in a few.
I just want to settle down.
Traveling just gave me a voice as a photographer.
I know what I want to do.
I’m taking pictures. Just not the ones I want.
Burnt out from being at the studio all day.
Think I’ve just... lost my spark.
- Yeah? - Yeah. It's right up there.
If I could have one thing…
A place where we could create and...
help support one another and be like...
the center for new talent in the area.
Oh, no, I-- I like that. That sounds amazing.
The owner wants a year's rent,
- So why don’t you just-- - Don’t say “Ask my parents.
I think they’re growing tired of my starving- artist life.
You know what? I hate to admit it,
but working at my dad’s law firm doesn’t sound as terrible as it used to.
It’s easy for you to say. You’ve been traveling the world,
taking photos, inspiring people, dating interesting people,
too scared to leave my crappy day job
that I use as an excuse to not take my kind of photos.
I just blurted all that out.
Will you help me drop off my bags before heading to Nando’s?
not to turn into an office zombie.
This is like a whole new place.
- Look. My picture. - Oh, you mean my picture.
It’s my picture. I took it. I made this.
Yeah, but you gave it to me. It’s mine.
You know what’s funny? I got the same thing on my computer.
Ah, look at us. Best friends forever.
Where did all this come from? This wasn't hanging here before.
I want to be fearless enough to go after my dreams, like you.
Look at this photo. People need to see this.
Yeah, I don’t-- I ca-- I’m not ready.
And what d'you think will happen if...
you just let go and went for it?
I don’t know. I’d probably worry less.
Get some of these questions about my future answered.
It’s like a Christmas doll house… thing. Wha--
Try and open one of the doors.
I don't know. Maybe it just doesn’t open. I don’t know. Maybe it’s broke.
Maybe Gramps just gave me a defective calendar.
- in the Christmas spirit, too? - You got somewhere to be?
You’re s'posed to take me to Fernando’s.
Not when you keep talkin’ about Christmas stuff all the time.
♪ Fa- la- la- la- la- la la- la- la ♪
♪ While I tell of yule- tide treasure ♪
♪ Fa- la- la- la- la la- la- la- la ♪
♪ See the blazing yule before us ♪
♪ Fa- la- la- la- la la- la- la- la ♪
Let the 24 days of holiday hell begin.
Guess you decided to work after all.
Everyone will have their time with Santa. Okay?
- Take the picture, Abby. - I did!
- There you go, sweetheart. - Very nice.
That’s very nice. You keep your list. Okay.
Okay. Who’s the next kid? Who’s the next in line?
I thought we had extra help this year.
All the college students I hired got poached by the Christmas train.
That's it. I'm calling in the cavalry.
♪ We are young And haven't got a cent ♪
♪ Shoo bee doo bee doo bee ding ding ♪
♪ Barely have enough to pay the rent ♪
Fernando! It's such a pleasure to see you.
Josh, yes. I know you. You can help me wrangle the kids.
Hey, what about me?  Elf Fernan... do! What can I do?
That kind of enthusiasm gets you on crowd control.
I also work as a Uber driver,
a dog walker, and a Christmas caroler.
I’m not sure why you told me about the first two, but...
you can sing to the children as they impatiently wait in line.
I’m not going to disappoint you, Santa.
Great! Okay, let’s see some Christmas cheer.
Wanna go see that guy? You know who that guy is.
Santa Claus. Tell him anything. Anything you want.
I promise overtime and holiday pay.
Stop. I’ve always wanted to be in an elf costume, so thank you.
That was a good one. I can feel it.
Let’s go. This job is awesome. Let’s go.
- We were supposed to meet for lunch. - I know.
Urgent matter. Okay? Had to go to my apartment…
I didn’t know we were doing presents.
Plus, I know you’re on this anti- commercial holiday kick.
Look, it’s not even a Christmas present.
It’s just a gift I’m getting you around this time of year. Coincidence.
- If you don’t want it-- - I don't want to be rude.
- Can I open it now? - What you waitin’ on?
- Really. They're like-- - Actually, I should have.
- all this duct tape on your shoes-- - That’s what makes ’em cool.
- I love them so much! - Ahhh!
I thought they looked like you.
♪ ...a merry Christmas, We wish you a merry Christmas... ♪
- I am so sorry, OK. It's the weekend... - ♪...and a happy new year ♪
♪ We wish you a merry Christmas ♪
♪ We wish you a merry Christmas ♪
♪ We wish you a merry Christmas ♪
Oh, I almost forgot to tell you.
Yesterday I woke up, and the door for December 1st was open.
- Must be on a timer or something, right? - Was there something cool inside?
Just little toys. But get this.
But, wait. I want to tell her.
the greatest Christmas movie of all time is playing at The Roxy
A Christmas Story. And the three of us are going together!
Maybe four of us, if I find a girlfriend, but that’s probably not gonna happen.
It’s amazing because everyone dresses up as their favorite character.
Oh. I got dibs on the leg lamp.
The leg lamp is my costume. Okay?  Back off! My idea!
That... is a Christmas tradition I can get behind.
♪ Baby when I first saw you ♪
♪ I had a feeling so right ♪
- ♪ I'd never had such a Christmas Eve ♪ -
♪ If you go borrow his mind ♪
That tree came out of nowhere!
I'm so sorry. I guess I didn't tie it down properly.
Who doesn’t tie down a tree that’s on top of their car?
That would be me. Are you okay? How’s your car?
- We’re both fine. - It's my fault.
The guy at the tree farm recommended bungees, not twine, I didn't listen.
Yeah, well there’s a reason why twine jumping never caught on.
It's a good sign if you can make bad jokes at a time like this.
I’m pretty sure it died when I chopped it down.
That would make you an ax murderer.
I’m wanted at three different Christmas tree farms.
I’m gonna have to make a citizen’s arrest.
Okay, you win. I can’t keep up.
It’s from my emergency roadside assistance kit, and technically,
I should probably do this with a bigger car.
I didn’t sleep very much last night.
She found it in a shop in France just before we met.
I was on leave from the Air Force.
We passed each other in the entrance to the Louvre.
She dropped a book in the snow and...
I can’t believe I never knew any of this.
This is the time of the year I miss her the most.
It’s funny, 'cause she was so much like you.
Never bought into all this holiday hoopla.
Well, it looks like you have plenty of company, if you want it.
That’s the problem with having a great love.
The “pretty good” ones don’t stand a chance.
I’m heading to meet the guys over at the hobby shop. You want to join?
Just a bunch of old cats playing with toy trains.
I’ll see you at Corinne’s Christmas pageant later.
Is that today? Ah, I totally forgot. Don’t tell Sarah.
That calendar’s just a calendar, right?
♪ When I think about the time ♪
Come here! You were so fantastic, Corinne.
I think I was the only one without a camera phone in front of my face.
You were the best Sugar Plum Fairy up there.
Okay, but it’s not a competition.
Everyone is the best just for participating.
But she was the best by far.
By any chance, did you murder my tree with your car?
First of all, that tree was already a goner.
Any chance I could get the name of my accomplice in tree crimes?
- You have a kid that goes here? - No way. I don’t have a kid.
Don’t get me wrong. I want kids maybe... one day.
I just haven’t made one yet.
But I do have a niece, Corinne.
with the rest of the other staring people.
I don't know who she's talking to.
There she is! Hey, come over here, Jess!
Don’t judge her outfit too harshly. I’m a single dad with no sewing skills.
- I should probably get her home. - Yeah. No, it’s getting late.
- It was great running into you again. - So great seeing you.
Do you know who that was?
Ty hit me with a tree.
Ty Walker is the school's most eligible bachelor.
Amicable divorce, great job, and that’s all his hair.
Some of the single moms actually wear their nice yoga pants
to drop off their kids, all in hopes to get a piece of him.
And here he is, flirting with my little sister.
God, you’re gonna use this to lord over them with, aren’t you?
Oh, you have no idea how cutthroat elementary school is.
Speaking of, I need you to come through with some awesome
photos for the school’s charity auction. It’s the 22nd.
- Don’t forget, Abbs. - No, I would never.
I am gonna crush this auction.
- Are you heading out? - Yeah. See you guys later.
You’re scaring me with your panicked text messages.
I have to tell you something, but I need you to not think
That ship has sailed. Can you just tell me?
- Oh, the... three little toys. - Right.
How much wine have you had tonight?
Yeah, I gave you boots. But...
I got those when I was away,
not because of a freaky calendar telling me to do so.
And maybe because I'm a wonderful friend
- an equally as dope gift in return. - Josh!
Day two, I got a Christmas tree toy
and then the car ran over a Christmas tree.
Right, that is a little weird, but...
that just seems like a coincidence.
d'you kick somebody in the nutcracker?
I met the daughter of the guy whose Christmas tree I ran over,
and his daughter was dressed as a nutcracker.
And the strangest part about that is, I actually hit it off with her dad.
Are we talking about him or the calendar?
What else do you think is inside?
I don’t know. The door doesn’t open until midnight.
Well, I’ll wait up with you.
Was thinking about going to get some water.
You want some water? I want some water.
Ha, ha, ha, you're so funny.
- You did that! - No, I didn’t.
It looks like the wind's picking up.
Thank you all for coming to Santa’s village.
D'you feel like you’re waiting for something to happen? ’Cause I do.
You know it doesn’t help that we’re in candy cane central.
Hey, kid, you ready to go see Santa Claus?
- Please. Do it for Mama, Mason. - It’s Santa Claus.
- Come on, kid. - I don't wanna go.
Get your picture taken with old Santa.
Now look right there in the camera.
- Ow! Hey! - Where are your paren-- Hey!
- Abby! You okay? - Come help me.
No, you might’ve sprained that. I think you should get that checked out.
It’s no big deal. I’m good.
- Go to the clinic, please. - There’s a line of people waiting
to get their picture with Santa. I can't just leave.
Who else do you know that’s a photographer? Hmm.
You should go. I can’t have runaway candy cane injuries on my conscience.
Says here we have a potential sprain by candy cane.
A lot of that going around lately.
Yeah, that’s me. Abby the mortified elf.
Oh, first the tree. Now this.
Nothing an ibuprofen and a drink won’t fix.
Are you allowed to prescribe that?
That was actually my lame doctor way of asking you out.
I’ll see you around 6:00 at Santa’s village?
Must’ve got some good meds, huh?
I have a date with Ty tonight.
I was thinking of sneaking out around 5:00 to go home and change.
- Do you think you could cover for me? - Yeah.
- You're the best. - I got you.
There’s a guy? I thought you were the guy.
♪ Hey, baby. I'm coming down your chimney tonight ♪
♪ Hey, baby I'm coming down your chimney tonight ♪
♪ Don't want no milk or cookies 'Cause I... ♪
You got here just in time.
I didn’t know drinks were time- sensitive.
So, I got us this ride.
The nearest café is literally hundreds of steps away, and it could take us
almost three minutes to walk there.
Plus, I already got us tickets, so…
This is not the drink I had imagined
when you asked me out on a date, but…
So, what else do you do when you’re not…
I want to be a photographer.
I mean, I am a photographer.
We take all the holiday photos that are probably hanging up on your fridge.
But I don’t know how long I’m gonna work there. I mean, I--
I want to have my own space.
that’s a long way off, I mean, if it happens at all--
Uh, both my parents are surgeons,
So you just got into the family business?
But I’m the rebel for opening a clinic instead of becoming a surgeon.
I would rebel in that way.
We should do it again sometime.
I’ve been wanting to kiss you all night.
- You don’t have my number. - What are you waiting for?
- I’ll talk to you soon. - Okay.

♪ For the special time of the year ♪

Looks like you got your photo mojo back.
What’s creepy calendar? Come on. What did it predict today?
I don’t know. I decided to risk it and not check.
Well, tell me about this ride with the doc.
You gotta give him points for creativity.
I mean, did the date go well?

Haven’t seen much of you lately.
Is it work or that new fella's got you so preoccupied?
Now, you know Sarah’s been updating us.
planning these elaborate dates and showering me with gifts...
I was gonna say “flattering,” but yeah,
We’re spending all this time together, but...
it’s not like we’re really getting to know each other.
If you feel like he’s worth getting to know, you should
You can decide your next step based on what you learn.
- Age equals wisdom. - Oh, you’re so wise.
I figured you and him would have gotten together by now.
Josh has girlfriends all over the world.
Yeah, but he came back here, didn't he?
Hey! How about one of those cookies, son?
I got one with your name on it.
- Have some. - Thank you, son. Of course.
- You got us. - Caught in the act.
Um, well, we actually took a little vote and decided
that you can be the leg lamp.
For the movie, A Christmas Story.
I have a date, with Ty.
Fine. I will be the leg lamp.
Okay. I just need to find the leg, but--
I can still be the leg lamp.
I’m seeing him at three o'clock, so
I can meet you at the theater after.
Does this look like a face that would break a promise?
I’m stumped. I have no idea what this date is.
It is the season of giving.
And we’re gonna do a little giving back.
I try to come once a month.
I think it's important for her to know how fortunate we are.
And you think I need that, too?
We all do. The real reward is
knowing we make life a little better for these folks.
Are saints like you allowed to date mere humans like me?
Do you think she’s gonna make it?
She said she's gonna come, she’s--
- We have time, man. - What are you doing with that cell phone?
No one used cell phones in A Christmas Story.
- It’s 1983. - Can you get out of character for...
I don’t know what you’re talking about because I am Ralphie.
Hey, excuse me. Do you guys mind if I take some pictures of you?
Oh, you can take mine, but, uh,
don’t take his ugly mug. It might break the camera.
- Hm- hm. - Don’t listen to him.
- I was pretty handsome in my younger days. - Oh...
- too bad cameras weren’t invented then. -
You guys are old friends, huh?
I’ve been putting up with him for…
I have a best friend like that.
The guy that I’m dating brought me here.
Yeah, we’ve seen him here a few times.
Yeah, he likes to bring people by and, uh, show ’em how good he is.
He said he brought his daughter here a few times.
I'm going to let you in on a little secret,
and it's not because you're enamored by my beauty.
People can show you whatever they want.
But it's how they make you feel... that counts.
And how you make them feel, too.
Oh yeah, let’s do one of these.
- Josh? - Which holiday movie has been remade
- You have 30 seconds to answer. - Get-- Okay.
I think I got some great shots.
You too. Have a great Christmas.
- Thank you. - You guys take care, okay?
Looks like you made new friends.
- Have you ever talked to them? - So many people go through the food line,
Well, they have a really interesting history.
I try not to get too attached. It’s the doctor in me.
Yeah. No. Can we go to the Roxy?
A Christmas Story is playing, and--
- Yeah, of course. - I should be there.
What’s the big deal? It plays nonstop
- all through the holidays. - My friends are in there.
I said that I would see it with them.
You were doing something way more important than a movie.
- These are great. Are all these yours? - Mm- hm.
You’re always taking pictures, aren’t you?
Uh, my friend Josh took that one.
Reminds me of one of Jess’s selfies.
Oh, we have one of these at our house.
- Except ours is made of cardboard. - Oh, yeah?
Oh, wait. Uh, no, no, no. It’s really--
It’s an antique, so it’s, like--
What kind of candy is in yours?
I just realized something and it shouldn't surprise me anymore,
the day that I met you,
I got a Christmas tree toy from the calendar, and then...
your tree fell on my car.
It's been like that all month long.
the toy inside matches something that happens.
Like today, the men at the shelter were obviously the three wise men.
It sounds like the Christmas equivalent of having your horoscope read.
“Oh, I’m a Virgo. My horoscope says I’m gonna meet someone new today.”
Well, of course, if you leave your house,
the chance of you meeting someone new increases exponentially.
You mocked me a little. No?
- Come on. It’s kinda funny. - It’s not funny.
Ah, you’re too smart to believe that
a toy- filled calendar is controlling your life.
- I’m just being a realist here. - You’re kinda being a jerk
Why are you so sensitive all of a sudden?
Hey, Ty, I have a question.
How many girls have you taken to see you do good work at the shelter?
Well, the two wise men seem to think that’s a common date spot for you.
You’re taking dating advice from two guys that live on the street?
I thought you cared about the people at the shelter.
- Or is that just all for show? - That’s not what I’m saying.
What do you know about me?
What do you know about me?
I mean, what do I even know about you, right?
We haven’t even had a real conversation up until now.
- I thought you were having a good time. - I am.
But I-- You know, I need more than someone that just looks good on paper.
You know, I need someone real.
Someone who’s not gonna judge me.
You want to take some space...
You’re breaking up with me over a calendar?
I was with my gramps this morning, okay?
You can open up that door
I’m in a fight with a calendar.
♪ Deck the halls with boughs of holly... ♪
The mayor’s doing a tree- lighting ceremony.
I might have, sort of, broken up with Ty.
You might have? Sort of? You did?
I made the mistake of showing him my calendar.
It all went downhill from there.
You want me to go beat him up, or what?
No, he’s probably, like, a black belt in karate or something.
I feel like a jerk for missing the movie.
That wasn’t cool, standing me up. That’s--
I can't stay mad at that.
What are you two standing around for?
and her official photographer has the flu.
Grab your camera, Abby. They’re going to need pictures.

Come. The mayor wants to meet you.
Here. I’ll load it. Go meet the mayor.

- Thank you. - What a beautiful night.
I would like you to meet photographer, Abby Sutton.
and I'm sure you're going to be pleased with her work.
Thank you so much for stepping up today, Abby.
I can't wait to see your photographs.
- What else do you shoot? - Um--
Well, I've been working on a new series.
It's been focusing on capturing the town in unexpected ways.
Send me a link to your stuff.
I need some fresh images for my office.
- I'd love to see what you have. Okay. Bye. - Merry Christmas.
Get me the best shots, and I’ll send them to the mayor
and to the newspaper before anybody else can.
The mayor wants to see my photography.
It’s the break I’ve been looking for.
I don’t like that face. What’s going on?
When I was trying to load the card in the computer…
...this family came by, was talking to me,
asking about when Santa Claus was coming back.
when they was talking to me, I…
I'm working on recovering the photos, but there's no guarantee that it will work.
You should pack your things and go.
I just heard you talking to Singh. What did he say?
Are you going to re- shoot the mayor?
I would if I didn’t just get fired.
- Seriously? - Yep! I'm giving my job to you. Congrats.
It was my fault. Look. I can go tell Singh right now.
It's my card. It's my responsibility. I'm the one who let it outta my sight.
But you gave it to me.
There's no reason for both of us to lose our jobs.
You knew how much I needed this break, and now it's ruined.
So yeah, I'm mad at you.
I would never do anything to hurt you ever,
- and you know that. - I know that
but I can’t help the fact that I’m still angry, at you.
you standing me up for Mr. Dream Doctor Dude-
I don’t need you, and I don’t need this job, and I don’t need any of this.
That’s not how friends treat each other, Abby.
You just answered so I know you are.
Sarah, I really don’t feel like having any…
It reeks like a pity party in here.
Gramps. He ran into Josh while hoofing it down Main Street.
Great. My personal drama is trending.
I get it. Break- ups sucks.
And losing a job, even a crappy one, sucks even more.
But pushing away the people that care about you is just selfish, Abs.
